org.seedstack.w20.spi

Interface FragmentConfigurationHandler


  • public interface FragmentConfigurationHandler
    This interface can be implemented to override W20 default configuration with custom code.
    Author:
    adrien.lauer@mpsa.com

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void overrideConfiguration(String fragmentName, String moduleName, Map<String,Object> sourceConfiguration)
      Provides the opportunity to override a module configuration.
      Boolean overrideFragmentStatus(String fragmentName)
      Provides the opportunity to override if a fragment is enabled or not.
      Boolean overrideModuleStatus(String fragmentName, String moduleName)
      Provides the opportunity to override a module status inside a fragment.
      void overrideVariables(String fragmentName, Map<String,String> variables)
      Provides the opportunity to override a fragment variables.

    • Method Detail

      • overrideFragmentStatus

        Boolean overrideFragmentStatus(String fragmentName)
        Provides the opportunity to override if a fragment is enabled or not. This method is called for each fragment detected.
        Parameters:
        fragmentName - the fragment name to override.
        Returns:
        true if the fragment should be enabled, false if the fragment should be disabled, null if it shouldn't be altered by this handler.

      • overrideModuleStatus

        Boolean overrideModuleStatus(String fragmentName,
                             String moduleName)
        Provides the opportunity to override a module status inside a fragment. This method is called for each module of each fragment detected.
        Parameters:
        fragmentName - the fragment name to override.
        moduleName - the module name to override.
        Returns:
        true if the module should be enabled, false if the module should be disabled, null if it shouldn't be altered by this handler.

      • overrideConfiguration

        void overrideConfiguration(String fragmentName,
                           String moduleName,
                           Map<String,Object> sourceConfiguration)
        Provides the opportunity to override a module configuration. This method is called for each module of each fragment detected.
        Parameters:
        fragmentName - the fragment name to override.
        moduleName - the module name to override.
        sourceConfiguration - the writable module configuration.

      • overrideVariables

        void overrideVariables(String fragmentName,
                       Map<String,String> variables)
        Provides the opportunity to override a fragment variables. This method is called for each fragment detected.
        Parameters:
        fragmentName - the fragment name to override.
        variables - the writable fragment variables.
